386
387    /**
388     * Validate that the URL provided is really a relative URL.
389     *
390     * @param targetUrl URL to validate.
391     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
392     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/ssrf"
393     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/q/6785442"
394     */
395    public static boolean isRelativeURL(String targetUrl) {
396        boolean isValid = false;
397        //Reject any URL encoded content and URL starting with a double slash
398        //Reject any URL contains credentials or fragment to prevent potential bypasses
399        String work = targetUrl;
400        if (!work.contains("%") && !work.contains("@") && !work.contains("#") && !work.startsWith("//")) {
401            //Creation of a URL object must fail
402            try {
403                new URL(work);
404                isValid = false;
405            } catch (MalformedURLException mf) {
406                //Last check to be sure (for prod usage compile the pattern one time)
407                isValid = Pattern.compile("^/[a-z0-9]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE).matcher(work).find();
408            }
409        }
410        return isValid;
411    }
412
413    /**
414     * Apply a collection of validations on a ZIP file provided:
415     * <ul>
416     * <li>Real ZIP file.</li>
417     * <li>Contain less than a specified level of deepness.</li>
418     * <li>Do not contain Zip-Slip entry path.</li>
419     * </ul>
420     *
421     * @param zipFilePath       Filename of the ZIP file to check.
422     * @param maxLevelDeepness  Threshold of deepness above which a ZIP archive will be rejected.
423     * @param rejectArchiveFile Flag to specify if presence of any archive entry will cause the rejection of the ZIP file.
424     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
425     * @see "https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/type/Security%20Hotspot/RSPEC-5042"
426     * @see "https://security.snyk.io/research/zip-slip-vulnerability"
427     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip_bomb"
428     * @see "https://github.com/ptoomey3/evilarc"
429     * @see "https://github.com/abdulfatir/ZipBomb"
430     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/cs/zip-bomb"
431     * @see "https://thesecurityvault.com/attacks-with-zip-files-and-mitigations/"
432     * @see "https://wiki.sei.cmu.edu/confluence/display/java/IDS04-J.+Safely+extract+files+from+ZipInputStream"
433     */
434    public static boolean isZIPSafe(String zipFilePath, int maxLevelDeepness, boolean rejectArchiveFile) {
435        List<String> archiveExtensions = Arrays.asList("zip", "tar", "7z", "gz", "jar", "phar", "bz2", "tgz");
436        boolean isSafe = false;
437        try {
438            File zipFile = new File(zipFilePath);
439            if (zipFile.exists() && zipFile.canRead() && zipFile.isFile() && maxLevelDeepness > 0) {
440                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid ZIP file
441                try (ZipFile zipArch = new ZipFile(zipFile)) {
442                    //Step 2: Parse entries
443                    long deepness = 0;
444                    ZipEntry zipEntry;
445                    String entryExtension;
446                    String zipEntryName;
447                    boolean validationsFailed = false;
448                    Enumeration<? extends ZipEntry> entries = zipArch.entries();
449                    while (entries.hasMoreElements()) {
450                        zipEntry = entries.nextElement();
451                        zipEntryName = zipEntry.getName();
452                        entryExtension = zipEntryName.substring(zipEntryName.lastIndexOf(".") + 1).toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).trim();
453                        //Step 2a: Check if the current entry is an archive file
454                        if (rejectArchiveFile && archiveExtensions.contains(entryExtension)) {
455                            validationsFailed = true;
456                            break;
457                        }
458                        //Step 2b: Check that level of deepness is inferior to the threshold specified
459                        if (zipEntryName.contains("/")) {
460                            //Determine deepness by inspecting the entry name.
461                            //Indeed, folder will be represented like this: folder/folder/folder/
462                            //So we can count the number of "/" to identify the deepness of the entry
463                            deepness = zipEntryName.chars().filter(ch -> ch == '/').count();
464                            if (deepness > maxLevelDeepness) {
465                                validationsFailed = true;
466                                break;
467                            }
468                        }
469                        //Step 2c: Check if any entries match pattern of zip slip payload
470                        if (zipEntryName.contains("..\\") || zipEntryName.contains("../")) {
471                            validationsFailed = true;
472                            break;
473                        }
474                    }
475                    if (!validationsFailed) {
476                        isSafe = true;
477                    }
478                }
479            }
480        } catch (Exception e) {
481            isSafe = false;
482        }
483        return isSafe;
484    }
485
486    /**
487     * Identify the mime type of the content specified (array of bytes).<br>
488     * Note that it cannot be fully trusted (see the tweet '1595824709186519041' referenced), so, additional validations are required.
489     *
490     * @param content The content as an array of bytes.
491     * @return The mime type in lower case or null if it cannot be identified.
492     * @see "https://twitter.com/righettod/status/1595824709186519041"
493     * @see "https://tika.apache.org/"
494     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.tika/tika-core"
495     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types"
496     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml"
497     */
498    public static String identifyMimeType(byte[] content) {
499        String mimeType = null;
500        if (content != null && content.length > 0) {
501            Detector detector = new DefaultDetector(MimeTypes.getDefaultMimeTypes());
502            Metadata metadata = new Metadata();
503            try {
504                try (TemporaryResources temporaryResources = new TemporaryResources(); TikaInputStream tikaInputStream = TikaInputStream.get(new ByteArrayInputStream(content), temporaryResources, metadata)) {
505                    MediaType mt = detector.detect(tikaInputStream, metadata);
506                    if (mt != null) {
507                        mimeType = mt.toString().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
508                    }
509                }
510            } catch (IOException ioe) {
511                mimeType = null;
512            }
513        }
514        return mimeType;
515    }
516
517    /**
518     * Apply a collection of validations on a string expected to be an public IP address:
519     * <ul>
520     * <li>Is a valid IP v4 or v6 address.</li>
521     * <li>Is public from an Internet perspective.</li>
522     * </ul>
523     * <br>
524     * <b>Note:</b> I often see missing such validation in the value read from HTTP request headers like "X-Forwarded-For" or "Forwarded".
525     * <br><br>
526     * <b>Note for IPv6:</b> I used documentation found so it is really experimental!
527     *
528     * @param ip String expected to be a valid IP address.
529     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
530     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/"
531     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/InetAddressValidator.html"
532     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html"
533     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/assets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet_Orange_Tsai_Talk.pdf"
534     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/assets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet_SSRF_Bible.pdf"
535     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Forwarded-For"
536     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Forwarded"
537     * @see "https://ipcisco.com/lesson/ipv6-address/"
538     * @see "https://www.juniper.net/documentation/us/en/software/junos/interfaces-security-devices/topics/topic-map/security-interface-ipv4-ipv6-protocol.html"
539     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/21/docs/api/java.base/java/net/InetAddress.html#getByName(java.lang.String)"
540     * @see "https://www.arin.net/reference/research/statistics/address_filters/"
541     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multicast_address"
542     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/5619409"
543     * @see "https://www.ripe.net/media/documents/ipv6-address-types.pdf"
544     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/ipv6-unicast-address-assignments/ipv6-unicast-address-assignments.xhtml"
545     * @see "https://developer.android.com/reference/java/net/Inet6Address"
546     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unique_local_address"
547     */
548    public static boolean isPublicIPAddress(String ip) {
549        boolean isValid = false;
550        try {
551            //Quick validation on the string itself based on characters used to compose an IP v4/v6 address
552            if (Pattern.matches("[0-9a-fA-F:.]+", ip)) {
553                //If OK then use the dedicated InetAddressValidator from Apache Commons Validator
554                if (InetAddressValidator.getInstance().isValid(ip)) {
555                    //If OK then validate that is an public IP address
556                    //From Javadoc for "InetAddress.getByName": If a literal IP address is supplied, only the validity of the address format is checked.
557                    InetAddress addr = InetAddress.getByName(ip);
558                    isValid = (!addr.isAnyLocalAddress() && !addr.isLinkLocalAddress() && !addr.isLoopbackAddress() && !addr.isMulticastAddress() && !addr.isSiteLocalAddress());
559                    //If OK and the IP is an V6 one then make additional validation because the built-in Java API will let pass some V6 IP
560                    //For the prefix map, the start of the key indicates if the value is a regex or a string
561                    if (isValid && (addr instanceof Inet6Address)) {
562                        Map<String, String> prefixes = new HashMap<>();
563                        prefixes.put("REGEX_LOOPBACK", "^(0|:)+1$");
564                        prefixes.put("REGEX_UNIQUE-LOCAL-ADDRESSES", "^f(c|d)[a-f0-9]{2}:.*$");
565                        prefixes.put("STRING_LINK-LOCAL-ADDRESSES", "fe80:");
566                        prefixes.put("REGEX_TEREDO", "^2001:[0]*:.*$");
567                        prefixes.put("REGEX_BENCHMARKING", "^2001:[0]*2:.*$");
568                        prefixes.put("REGEX_ORCHID", "^2001:[0]*10:.*$");
569                        prefixes.put("STRING_DOCUMENTATION", "2001:db8:");
570                        prefixes.put("STRING_GLOBAL-UNICAST", "2000:");
571                        prefixes.put("REGEX_MULTICAST", "^ff[0-9]{2}:.*$");
572                        final List<Boolean> results = new ArrayList<>();
573                        final String ipLower = ip.trim().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
574                        prefixes.forEach((addressType, expr) -> {
575                            String exprLower = expr.trim().toLowerCase();
576                            if (addressType.startsWith("STRING_")) {
577                                results.add(ipLower.startsWith(exprLower));
578                            } else {
579                                results.add(Pattern.matches(exprLower, ipLower));
580                            }
581                        });
582                        isValid = ((results.size() == prefixes.size()) && !results.contains(Boolean.TRUE));
583                    }
584                }
585            }
586        } catch (Exception e) {
587            isValid = false;
588        }
589        return isValid;
590    }
591
592    /**
593     * Compute a SHA256 hash from an input composed of a collection of strings.<br><br>
594     * This method take care to build the source string in a way to prevent this source string to be prone to abuse targeting the different parts composing it.<br><br>
595     * <p>
596     * Example of possible abuse without precautions applied during the hash calculation logic:<br>
597     * Hash of <code>SHA256("Hello", "My", "World!!!")</code> will be equals to the hash of <code>SHA256("Hell", "oMyW", "orld!!!")</code>.<br>
598     * </p>
599     * This method ensure that both hash above will be different.<br><br>
600     *
601     * <b>Note:</b> The character <code>|</code> is used, as separator, of every parts so a part is not allowed to contains this character.
602     *
603     * @param parts Ordered list of strings to use to build the input string for which the hash must be computed on. No null value is accepted on object composing the collection.
604     * @return The hash, as an array of bytes, to allow caller to convert it to the final representation wanted (HEX, Base64, etc.). If the collection passed is null or empty then the method return null.
605     * @throws Exception If any exception occurs
606     * @see "https://github.com/righettod/code-snippets-security-utils/issues/16"
607     * @see "https://pentesterlab.com/badges/codereview"
608     * @see "https://blog.trailofbits.com/2024/08/21/yolo-is-not-a-valid-hash-construction/"
609     * @see "https://www.nist.gov/publications/sha-3-derived-functions-cshake-kmac-tuplehash-and-parallelhash"
610     */
611    public static byte[] computeHashNoProneToAbuseOnParts(List<String> parts) throws Exception {
612        byte[] hash = null;
613        String separator = "|";
614        if (parts != null && !parts.isEmpty()) {
615            //Ensure that not part is null
616            if (parts.stream().anyMatch(Objects::isNull)) {
617                throw new IllegalArgumentException("No part must be null!");
618            }
619            //Ensure that the separator is absent from every part
620            if (parts.stream().anyMatch(part -> part.contains(separator))) {
621                throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format("The character '%s', used as parts separator, must be absent from every parts!", separator));
622            }
623            MessageDigest digest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-256");
624            final StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder(separator);
625            parts.forEach(p -> {
626                buffer.append(p).append(separator);
627            });
628            hash = digest.digest(buffer.toString().getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
629        }
630        return hash;
631    }
632
633    /**
634     * Ensure that an XML file only uses DTD/XSD references (called System Identifier) present in the allowed list provided.<br><br>
635     * The code is based on the validation implemented into the OpenJDK 21, by the class <b><a href="https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java">java.util.prefs.XmlSupport</a></b>, in the method <b><a href="https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java#L240">loadPrefsDoc()</a></b>.<br><br>
636     * The method also ensure that no Public Identifier is used to prevent potential bypasses of the validations.
637     *
638     * @param xmlFilePath              Filename of the XML file to check.
639     * @param allowedSystemIdentifiers List of URL allowed for System Identifier specified for any XSD/DTD references.
640     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
641     * @see "https://www.w3schools.com/xml/prop_documenttype_systemid.asp"
642     * @see "https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/integration-bus/9.0.0?topic=doctypedecl-xml-systemid"
643     * @see "https://www.liquid-technologies.com/Reference/Glossary/XML_DocType.html"
644     * @see "https://www.xml.com/pub/98/08/xmlqna0.html"
645     * @see "https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java#L397"
646     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Formal_Public_Identifier"
647     */
648    public static boolean isXMLOnlyUseAllowedXSDorDTD(String xmlFilePath, final List<String> allowedSystemIdentifiers) {
649        boolean isSafe = false;
650        final String errorTemplate = "Non allowed %s ID detected!";
651        final String emptyFakeDTD = "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?><!ELEMENT dummy EMPTY>";
652        final String emptyFakeXSD = "<xs:schema xmlns:xs=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema\"> <xs:element name=\"dummy\"/></xs:schema>";
653
654        if (allowedSystemIdentifiers == null || allowedSystemIdentifiers.isEmpty()) {
655            throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least one SID must be specified!");
656        }
657        File xmlFile = new File(xmlFilePath);
658        if (xmlFile.exists() && xmlFile.canRead() && xmlFile.isFile()) {
659            try {
660                EntityResolver resolverValidator = (publicId, systemId) -> {
661                    if (publicId != null) {
662                        throw new SAXException(String.format(errorTemplate, "PUBLIC"));
663                    }
664                    if (!allowedSystemIdentifiers.contains(systemId)) {
665                        throw new SAXException(String.format(errorTemplate, "SYSTEM"));
666                    }
667                    //If it is OK then return a empty DTD/XSD
668                    return new InputSource(new StringReader(systemId.toLowerCase().endsWith(".dtd") ? emptyFakeDTD : emptyFakeXSD));
669                };
670                DocumentBuilderFactory dbfInstance = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
671                dbfInstance.setIgnoringElementContentWhitespace(true);
672                dbfInstance.setXIncludeAware(false);
673                dbfInstance.setValidating(false);
674                dbfInstance.setCoalescing(true);
675                dbfInstance.setIgnoringComments(false);
676                DocumentBuilder builder = dbfInstance.newDocumentBuilder();
677                builder.setEntityResolver(resolverValidator);
678                Document doc = builder.parse(xmlFile);
679                isSafe = (doc != null);
680            } catch (SAXException | IOException | ParserConfigurationException e) {
681                isSafe = false;
682            }
683        }
684
685        return isSafe;
686    }
687
688    /**
689     * Apply a collection of validations on a EXCEL CSV file provided (file was expected to be opened in Microsoft EXCEL):
690     * <ul>
691     * <li>Real CSV file.</li>
692     * <li>Do not contains any payload related to a CSV injections.</li>
693     * </ul>
694     * Ensure that, if Apache Commons CSV does not find any record then, the file will be considered as NOT safe (prevent potential bypasses).<br><br>
695     * <b>Note:</b> Record delimiter used is the <code>,</code> (comma) character. See the Apache Commons CSV reference provided for EXCEL.<br>
696     *
697     * @param csvFilePath Filename of the CSV file to check.
698     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
699     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-csv/"
700     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-csv/apidocs/org/apache/commons/csv/CSVFormat.html#EXCEL"
701     * @see "https://www.we45.com/post/your-excel-sheets-are-not-safe-heres-how-to-beat-csv-injection"
702     * @see "https://www.whiteoaksecurity.com/blog/2020-4-23-csv-injection-whats-the-risk/"
703     * @see "https://book.hacktricks.xyz/pentesting-web/formula-csv-doc-latex-ghostscript-injection"
704     * @see "https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/CSV_Injection"
705     * @see "https://payatu.com/blog/csv-injection-basic-to-exploit/"
706     * @see "https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/1236.html"
707     */
708    public static boolean isExcelCSVSafe(String csvFilePath) {
709        boolean isSafe;
710        final AtomicInteger recordCount = new AtomicInteger();
711        final List<Character> payloadDetectionCharacters = List.of('=', '+', '@', '-', '\r', '\t');
712
713        try {
714            final List<String> payloadsIdentified = new ArrayList<>();
715            try (Reader in = new FileReader(csvFilePath)) {
716                Iterable<CSVRecord> records = CSVFormat.EXCEL.parse(in);
717                records.forEach(record -> {
718                    record.forEach(recordValue -> {
719                        if (recordValue != null && !recordValue.trim().isEmpty() && payloadDetectionCharacters.contains(recordValue.trim().charAt(0))) {
720                            payloadsIdentified.add(recordValue);
721                        }
722                        recordCount.getAndIncrement();
723                    });
724                });
725            }
726            isSafe = (payloadsIdentified.isEmpty() && recordCount.get() > 0);
727        } catch (Exception e) {
728            isSafe = false;
729        }
730
731        return isSafe;
732    }
733
734    /**
735     * Provide a way to add an integrity marker (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAC">HMAC</a>) to a serialized object serialized using the <a href="https://www.baeldung.com/java-serialization">java native system</a> (binary).<br>
736     * The goal is to provide <b>a temporary workaround</b> to try to prevent deserialization attacks and give time to move to a text-based serialization approach.
737     *
738     * @param processingModeType Define the mode of processing i.e. protect or validate. ({@link eu.righettod.ProcessingMode})
739     * @param input          When the processing mode is "protect" than the expected input (string) is a java serialized object encoded in Base64 otherwise (processing mode is "validate") expected input is the output of this method when the "protect" mode was used.
740     * @param secret         Secret to use to compute the SHA256 HMAC.
741     * @return A map with the following keys: <ul><li><b>PROCESSING_MODE</b>: Processing mode used to compute the result.</li><li><b>STATUS</b>: A boolean indicating if the processing was successful or not.</li><li><b>RESULT</b>: Always contains a string representing the protected serialized object in the format <code>[SERIALIZED_OBJECT_BASE64_ENCODED]:[SERIALIZED_OBJECT_HMAC_BASE64_ENCODED]</code>.</li></ul>
742     * @throws Exception If any exception occurs.
743     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Deserialization_Cheat_Sheet.html"
744     * @see "https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/2017/A8_2017-Insecure_Deserialization"
745     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/deserialization"
746     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/java-serialization-approaches"
747     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/java-serialization"
748     * @see "https://cryptobook.nakov.com/mac-and-key-derivation/hmac-and-key-derivation"
749     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAC"
750     * @see "https://smattme.com/posts/how-to-generate-hmac-signature-in-java/"
751     */
752    public static Map<String, Object> ensureSerializedObjectIntegrity(ProcessingMode processingModeType, String input, byte[] secret) throws Exception {
753        Map<String, Object> results;
754        String resultFormatTemplate = "%s:%s";
755        //Verify input provided to be consistent
756        if (processingModeType == null) {
757            throw new IllegalArgumentException("The processing mode is mandatory!");
758        }
759        if (input == null || input.trim().isEmpty()) {
760            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Input data is mandatory!");
761        }
762        if (secret == null || secret.length == 0) {
763            throw new IllegalArgumentException("The HMAC secret is mandatory!");
764        }
765        if (processingModeType.equals(ProcessingMode.VALIDATE) && input.split(":").length != 2) {
766            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Input data provided is invalid for the processing mode specified!");
767        }
768        //Processing
769        Base64.Decoder b64Decoder = Base64.getDecoder();
770        Base64.Encoder b64Encoder = Base64.getEncoder();
771        String hmacAlgorithm = "HmacSHA256";
772        Mac mac = Mac.getInstance(hmacAlgorithm);
773        SecretKeySpec key = new SecretKeySpec(secret, hmacAlgorithm);
774        mac.init(key);
775        results = new HashMap<>();
776        results.put("PROCESSING_MODE", processingModeType.toString());
777        switch (processingModeType) {
778            case PROTECT -> {
779                byte[] objectBytes = b64Decoder.decode(input);
780                byte[] hmac = mac.doFinal(objectBytes);
781                String encodedHmac = b64Encoder.encodeToString(hmac);
782                results.put("STATUS", Boolean.TRUE);
783                results.put("RESULT", String.format(resultFormatTemplate, input, encodedHmac));
784            }
785            case VALIDATE -> {
786                String[] parts = input.split(":");
787                byte[] objectBytes = b64Decoder.decode(parts[0].trim());
788                byte[] hmacProvided = b64Decoder.decode(parts[1].trim());
789                byte[] hmacComputed = mac.doFinal(objectBytes);
790                String encodedHmacComputed = b64Encoder.encodeToString(hmacComputed);
791                Boolean hmacIsValid = Arrays.equals(hmacProvided, hmacComputed);
792                results.put("STATUS", hmacIsValid);
793                results.put("RESULT", String.format(resultFormatTemplate, parts[0].trim(), encodedHmacComputed));
794            }
795            default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Not supported processing mode!");
796        }
797        return results;
798    }
799
800    /**
801     * Apply a collection of validations on a JSON string provided:
802     * <ul>
803     * <li>Real JSON structure.</li>
804     * <li>Contain less than a specified number of deepness for nested objects or arrays.</li>
805     * <li>Contain less than a specified number of items in any arrays.</li>
806     * </ul>
807     * <br>
808     * <b>Note:</b> I decided to use a parsing approach using only string processing to prevent any StackOverFlow or OutOfMemory error that can be abused.<br><br>
809     * I used the following assumption:
810     * <ul>
811     *      <li>The character <code>{</code> identify the beginning of an object.</li>
812     *      <li>The character <code>}</code> identify the end of an object.</li>
813     *      <li>The character <code>[</code> identify the beginning of an array.</li>
814     *      <li>The character <code>]</code> identify the end of an array.</li>
815     *      <li>The character <code>"</code> identify the delimiter of a string.</li>
816     *      <li>The character sequence <code>\"</code> identify the escaping of an double quote.</li>
817     * </ul>
818     *
819     * @param json                  String containing the JSON data to validate.
820     * @param maxItemsByArraysCount Maximum number of items allowed in an array.
821     * @param maxDeepnessAllowed    Maximum number nested objects or arrays allowed.
822     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
823     * @see "https://javaee.github.io/jsonp/"
824     * @see "https://community.f5.com/discussions/technicalforum/disable-buffer-overflow-in-json-parameters/124306"
825     * @see "https://github.com/InductiveComputerScience/pbJson/issues/2"
826     */
827    public static boolean isJSONSafe(String json, int maxItemsByArraysCount, int maxDeepnessAllowed) {
828        boolean isSafe = false;
829
830        try {
831            //Step 1: Analyse the JSON string
832            int currentDeepness = 0;
833            int currentArrayItemsCount = 0;
834            int maxDeepnessReached = 0;
835            int maxArrayItemsCountReached = 0;
836            boolean currentlyInArray = false;
837            boolean currentlyInString = false;
838            int currentNestedArrayLevel = 0;
839            String jsonEscapedDoubleQuote = "\\\"";//Escaped double quote must not be considered as a string delimiter
840            String work = json.replace(jsonEscapedDoubleQuote, "'");
841            for (char c : work.toCharArray()) {
842                switch (c) {
843                    case '{': {
844                        if (!currentlyInString) {
845                            currentDeepness++;
846                        }
847                        break;
848                    }
849                    case '}': {
850                        if (!currentlyInString) {
851                            currentDeepness--;
852                        }
853                        break;
854                    }
855                    case '[': {
856                        if (!currentlyInString) {
857                            currentDeepness++;
858                            if (currentlyInArray) {
859                                currentNestedArrayLevel++;
860                            }
861                            currentlyInArray = true;
862                        }
863                        break;
864                    }
865                    case ']': {
866                        if (!currentlyInString) {
867                            currentDeepness--;
868                            currentArrayItemsCount = 0;
869                            if (currentNestedArrayLevel > 0) {
870                                currentNestedArrayLevel--;
871                            }
872                            if (currentNestedArrayLevel == 0) {
873                                currentlyInArray = false;
874                            }
875                        }
876                        break;
877                    }
878                    case '"': {
879                        currentlyInString = !currentlyInString;
880                        break;
881                    }
882                    case ',': {
883                        if (!currentlyInString && currentlyInArray) {
884                            currentArrayItemsCount++;
885                        }
886                        break;
887                    }
888                }
889                if (currentDeepness > maxDeepnessReached) {
890                    maxDeepnessReached = currentDeepness;
891                }
892                if (currentArrayItemsCount > maxArrayItemsCountReached) {
893                    maxArrayItemsCountReached = currentArrayItemsCount;
894                }
895            }
896            //Step 2: Apply validation against the value specified as limits
897            isSafe = ((maxItemsByArraysCount > maxArrayItemsCountReached) && (maxDeepnessAllowed > maxDeepnessReached));
898
899            //Step 3: If the content is safe then ensure that it is valid JSON structure using the "Java API for JSON Processing" (JSR 374) parser reference implementation.
900            if (isSafe) {
901                JsonReader reader = Json.createReader(new StringReader(json));
902                isSafe = (reader.read() != null);
903            }
904
905        } catch (Exception e) {
906            isSafe = false;
907        }
908        return isSafe;
909    }
910
911    /**
912     * Apply a collection of validations on a image file provided:
913     * <ul>
914     * <li>Real image file.</li>
915     * <li>Its mime type is into the list of allowed mime types.</li>
916     * <li>Its metadata fields do not contains any characters related to a malicious payloads.</li>
917     * </ul>
918     * <br>
919     * <b>Important note:</b> This implementation is prone to bypass using the "<b>raw insertion</b>" method documented in the <a href="https://www.synacktiv.com/en/publications/persistent-php-payloads-in-pngs-how-to-inject-php-code-in-an-image-and-keep-it-there">blog post</a> from the Synacktiv team.
920     * To handle such case, it is recommended to resize the image to remove any non image-related content, see <a href="https://github.com/righettod/document-upload-protection/blob/master/src/main/java/eu/righettod/poc/sanitizer/ImageDocumentSanitizerImpl.java#L54">here</a> for an example.<br>
921     *
922     * @param imageFilePath         Filename of the image file to check.
923     * @param imageAllowedMimeTypes List of image mime types allowed.
924     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
925     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-imaging/"
926     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-imaging/formatsupport.html"
927     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types/Common_types"
928     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#image"
929     * @see "https://www.synacktiv.com/en/publications/persistent-php-payloads-in-pngs-how-to-inject-php-code-in-an-image-and-keep-it-there"
930     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/File_Upload_Cheat_Sheet.html"
931     * @see "https://github.com/righettod/document-upload-protection/blob/master/src/main/java/eu/righettod/poc/sanitizer/ImageDocumentSanitizerImpl.java"
932     * @see "https://exiftool.org/examples.html"
933     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_file_signatures"
934     * @see "https://hexed.it/"
935     * @see "https://github.com/sighook/pixload"
936     */
937    public static boolean isImageSafe(String imageFilePath, List<String> imageAllowedMimeTypes) {
938        boolean isSafe = false;
939        Pattern payloadDetectionRegex = Pattern.compile("[<>${}`]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
940        try {
941            File imgFile = new File(imageFilePath);
942            if (imgFile.exists() && imgFile.canRead() && imgFile.isFile() && !imageAllowedMimeTypes.isEmpty()) {
943                final byte[] imgBytes = Files.readAllBytes(imgFile.toPath());
944                //Step 1: Check the mime type of the file against the allowed ones
945                ImageInfo imgInfo = Imaging.getImageInfo(imgBytes);
946                if (imageAllowedMimeTypes.contains(imgInfo.getMimeType())) {
947                    //Step 2: Load the image into an object using the Image API
948                    BufferedImage imgObject = Imaging.getBufferedImage(imgBytes);
949                    if (imgObject != null && imgObject.getWidth() > 0 && imgObject.getHeight() > 0) {
950                        //Step 3: Check the metadata if the image format support it - Highly experimental
951                        List<String> metadataWithPayloads = new ArrayList<>();
952                        final ImageMetadata imgMetadata = Imaging.getMetadata(imgBytes);
953                        if (imgMetadata != null) {
954                            imgMetadata.getItems().forEach(item -> {
955                                String metadata = item.toString();
956                                if (payloadDetectionRegex.matcher(metadata).find()) {
957                                    metadataWithPayloads.add(metadata);
958                                }
959                            });
960                        }
961                        isSafe = metadataWithPayloads.isEmpty();
962                    }
963                }
964            }
965        } catch (Exception e) {
966            isSafe = false;
967        }
968        return isSafe;
969    }
970
971    /**
972     * Rewrite the input file to remove any embedded files that is not embedded using a methods supported by the official format of the file.<br>
973     * Example: a file can be embedded by adding it to the end of the source file, see the reference provided for details.
974     *
975     * @param inputFilePath Filename of the file to clean up.
976     * @param inputFileType Type of the file provided.
977     * @return A array of bytes with the cleaned file.
978     * @throws IllegalArgumentException If an invalid parameter is passed
979     * @throws Exception                If any technical error during the cleaning processing
980     * @see "https://www.synacktiv.com/en/publications/persistent-php-payloads-in-pngs-how-to-inject-php-code-in-an-image-and-keep-it-there"
981     * @see "https://github.com/righettod/toolbox-pentest-web/tree/master/misc"
982     * @see "https://github.com/righettod/toolbox-pentest-web?tab=readme-ov-file#misc"
983     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/13605411"
984     */
985    public static byte[] sanitizeFile(String inputFilePath, InputFileType inputFileType) throws Exception {
986        ByteArrayOutputStream sanitizedContent = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
987        File inputFile = new File(inputFilePath);
988        if (!inputFile.exists() || !inputFile.canRead() || !inputFile.isFile()) {
989            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot read the content of the input file!");
990        }
991        switch (inputFileType) {
992            case PDF -> {
993                try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(inputFile)) {
994                    document.save(sanitizedContent);
995                }
996            }
997            case IMAGE -> {
998                // Load the original image
999                BufferedImage originalImage = ImageIO.read(inputFile);
1000                String originalFormat = identifyMimeType(Files.readAllBytes(inputFile.toPath())).split("/")[1].trim();
1001                // Check that image has been successfully loaded
1002                if (originalImage == null) {
1003                    throw new IOException("Cannot load the original image !");
1004                }
1005                // Get current Width and Height of the image
1006                int originalWidth = originalImage.getWidth(null);
1007                int originalHeight = originalImage.getHeight(null);
1008                // Resize the image by removing 1px on Width and Height
1009                Image resizedImage = originalImage.getScaledInstance(originalWidth - 1, originalHeight - 1, Image.SCALE_SMOOTH);
1010                // Resize the resized image by adding 1px on Width and Height - In fact set image to is initial size
1011                Image initialSizedImage = resizedImage.getScaledInstance(originalWidth, originalHeight, Image.SCALE_SMOOTH);
1012                // Save image to a bytes buffer
1013                int bufferedImageType = BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB;//By default use a format supporting transparency
1014                if ("jpeg".equalsIgnoreCase(originalFormat) || "bmp".equalsIgnoreCase(originalFormat)) {
1015                    bufferedImageType = BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB;
1016                }
1017                BufferedImage sanitizedImage = new BufferedImage(initialSizedImage.getWidth(null), initialSizedImage.getHeight(null), bufferedImageType);
1018                Graphics2D drawer = sanitizedImage.createGraphics();
1019                drawer.drawImage(initialSizedImage, 0, 0, null);
1020                drawer.dispose();
1021                ImageIO.write(sanitizedImage, originalFormat, sanitizedContent);
1022            }
1023            default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Type of file not supported !");
1024        }
1025        if (sanitizedContent.size() == 0) {
1026            throw new IOException("An error occur during the rewrite operation!");
1027        }
1028        return sanitizedContent.toByteArray();
1029    }
1030
1031    /**
1032     * Apply a collection of validations on a string expected to be an email address:
1033     * <ul>
1034     * <li>Is a valid email address, from a parser perspective, following RFCs on email addresses.</li>
1035     * <li>Is not using "Encoded-word" format.</li>
1036     * <li>Is not using comment format.</li>
1037     * <li>Is not using "Punycode" format.</li>
1038     * <li>Is not using UUCP style addresses.</li>
1039     * <li>Is not using address literals.</li>
1040     * <li>Is not using source routes.</li>
1041     * <li>Is not using the "percent hack".</li>
1042     * </ul><br>
1043     * This is based on the research work from <a href="https://portswigger.net/research/gareth-heyes">Gareth Heyes</a> added in references (Portswigger).<br><br>
1044     *
1045     * <b>Note:</b> The notion of valid, here, is to take from a secure usage of the data perspective.
1046     *
1047     * @param addr String expected to be a valid email address.
1048     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
1049     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/"
1050     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/EmailValidator.html"
1051     * @see "https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc2047#section-2"
1052     * @see "https://portswigger.net/research/splitting-the-email-atom"
1053     * @see "https://www.jochentopf.com/email/address.html"
1054     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Email_address"
1055     */
1056    public static boolean isEmailAddress(String addr) {
1057        boolean isValid = false;
1058        String work = addr.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
1059        Pattern encodedWordRegex = Pattern.compile("[=?]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
1060        Pattern forbiddenCharacterRegex = Pattern.compile("[():!%\\[\\],;]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
1061        try {
1062            //Start with the use of the dedicated EmailValidator from Apache Commons Validator
1063            if (EmailValidator.getInstance(true, true).isValid(work)) {
1064                //If OK then validate it does not contains "Encoded-word" patterns using an aggressive approach
1065                if (!encodedWordRegex.matcher(work).find()) {
1066                    //If OK then validate it does not contains punycode
1067                    if (!work.contains("xn--")) {
1068                        //If OK then validate it does not use:
1069                        // UUCP style addresses,
1070                        // Comment format,
1071                        // Address literals,
1072                        // Source routes,
1073                        // The percent hack.
1074                        if (!forbiddenCharacterRegex.matcher(work).find()) {
1075                            isValid = true;
1076                        }
1077                    }
1078                }
1079            }
1080        } catch (Exception e) {
1081            isValid = false;
1082        }
1083        return isValid;
1084    }
1085
1086    /**
1087     * The <a href="https://www.stet.eu/en/psd2/">PSD2 STET</a> specification require to use <a href="https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-cavage-http-signatures/">HTTP Signature</a>.
1088     * <br>
1089     * Section <b>3.5.1.2</b> of the document <a href="https://www.stet.eu/assets/files/PSD2/1-6-3/api-dsp2-stet-v1.6.3.1-part-1-framework.pdf">Documentation Framework</a> version <b>1.6.3</b>.
1090     * <br>
1091     * The problem is that, by design, the HTTP Signature specification is prone to blind SSRF.
1092     * <br>
1093     * URL example taken from the STET specification: <code>https://path.to/myQsealCertificate_714f8154ec259ac40b8a9786c9908488b2582b68b17e865fede4636d726b709f</code>.
1094     * <br>
1095     * The objective of this code is to try to decrease the "exploitability/interest" of this SSRF for an attacker.
1096     *
1097     * @param certificateUrl Url pointing to a Qualified Certificate (QSealC) encoded in PEM format and respecting the ETSI/TS119495 technical Specification .
1098     * @return TRUE only if the url point to a Qualified Certificate in PEM format.
1099     * @see "https://www.stet.eu/en/psd2/"
1100     * @see "https://www.stet.eu/assets/files/PSD2/1-6-3/api-dsp2-stet-v1.6.3.1-part-1-framework.pdf"
1101     * @see "https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-cavage-http-signatures/"
1102     * @see "https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/rfc9421/"
1103     * @see "https://openjdk.org/groups/net/httpclient/intro.html"
1104     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/21/docs/api/java.net.http/java/net/http/package-summary.html"
1105     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/ssrf"
1106     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Cache-Control"
1107     */
1108    public static boolean isPSD2StetSafeCertificateURL(String certificateUrl) {
1109        boolean isValid = false;
1110        long connectionTimeoutInSeconds = 10;
1111        String userAgent = "PSD2-STET-HTTPSignature-CertificateRequest";
1112        try {
1113            //1. Ensure that the URL end with the SHA-256 fingerprint encoded in HEX of the certificate like requested by STET
1114            if (certificateUrl != null && certificateUrl.lastIndexOf("_") != -1) {
1115                String digestPart = certificateUrl.substring(certificateUrl.lastIndexOf("_") + 1);
1116                if (Pattern.matches("^[0-9a-f]{64}$", digestPart)) {
1117                    //2. Ensure that the URL is a valid url by creating a instance of the class URI
1118                    URI uri = URI.create(certificateUrl);
1119                    //3. Require usage of HTTPS and reject any url containing query parameters
1120                    if ("https".equalsIgnoreCase(uri.getScheme()) && uri.getQuery() == null) {
1121                        //4. Perform a HTTP HEAD request in order to get the content type of the remote resource
1122                        //and limit the interest to use the SSRF because to pass the check the url need to:
1123                        //- Do not having any query parameters.
1124                        //- Use HTTPS protocol.
1125                        //- End with a string having the format "_[0-9a-f]{64}".
1126                        //- Trigger the malicious action that the attacker want but with a HTTP HEAD without any redirect and parameters.
1127                        HttpResponse<String> response;
1128                        try (HttpClient client = HttpClient.newBuilder().followRedirects(HttpClient.Redirect.NEVER).build()) {
1129                            HttpRequest request = HttpRequest.newBuilder().uri(uri).timeout(Duration.ofSeconds(connectionTimeoutInSeconds)).method("HEAD", HttpRequest.BodyPublishers.noBody()).header("User-Agent", userAgent)//To provide an hint to the target about the initiator of the request
1130                                    .header("Cache-Control", "no-store, max-age=0")//To prevent caching issues or abuses
1131                                    .build();
1132                            response = client.send(request, HttpResponse.BodyHandlers.ofString());
1133                            if (response.statusCode() == 200) {
1134                                //5. Ensure that the response content type is "text/plain"
1135                                Optional<String> contentType = response.headers().firstValue("Content-Type");
1136                                isValid = (contentType.isPresent() && contentType.get().trim().toLowerCase(Locale.ENGLISH).startsWith("text/plain"));
1137                            }
1138                        }
1139                    }
1140                }
1141            }
1142        } catch (Exception e) {
1143            isValid = false;
1144        }
1145        return isValid;
1146    }
1147
1148    /**
1149     * Perform sequential URL decoding operations against a URL encoded data until the data is not URL encoded anymore or if the specified threshold is reached.
1150     *
1151     * @param encodedData            URL encoded data.
1152     * @param decodingRoundThreshold Threshold above which decoding will fail.
1153     * @return The decoded data.
1154     * @throws SecurityException If the threshold is reached.
1155     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding"
1156     * @see "https://owasp.org/www-community/Double_Encoding"
1157     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/essential-skills/obfuscating-attacks-using-encodings"
1158     * @see "https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/120.html"
1159     */
1160    public static String applyURLDecoding(String encodedData, int decodingRoundThreshold) throws SecurityException {
1161        if (decodingRoundThreshold < 1) {
1162            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Threshold must be a positive number !");
1163        }
1164        if (encodedData == null) {
1165            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Data provided must not be null !");
1166        }
1167        Charset charset = StandardCharsets.UTF_8;
1168        int currentDecodingRound = 0;
1169        boolean isFinished = false;
1170        String currentRoundData = encodedData;
1171        String previousRoundData = encodedData;
1172        while (!isFinished) {
1173            if (currentDecodingRound > decodingRoundThreshold) {
1174                throw new SecurityException(String.format("Decoding round threshold of %s reached!", decodingRoundThreshold));
1175            }
1176            currentRoundData = URLDecoder.decode(currentRoundData, charset);
1177            isFinished = currentRoundData.equals(previousRoundData);
1178            previousRoundData = currentRoundData;
1179            currentDecodingRound++;
1180        }
1181        return currentRoundData;
1182    }
1183
1184    /**
1185     * Apply a collection of validations on a string expected to be an system file/folder path:
1186     * <ul>
1187     * <li>Does not contains path traversal payload.</li>
1188     * <li>The canonical path is equals to the absolute path.</li>
1189     * </ul><br>
1190     *
1191     * @param path String expected to be a valid system file/folder path.
1192     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
1193     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/file-path-traversal"
1194     * @see "https://learn.snyk.io/lesson/directory-traversal/"
1195     * @see "https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/126.html"
1196     * @see "https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Path_Traversal"
1197     */
1198    public static boolean isPathSafe(String path) {
1199        boolean isSafe = false;
1200        int decodingRoundThreshold = 3;
1201        try {
1202            if (path != null && !path.isEmpty()) {
1203                //URL decode the path if case of data coming from a web context
1204                String decodedPath = applyURLDecoding(path, decodingRoundThreshold);
1205                //Ensure that no path traversal expression is present
1206                if (!decodedPath.contains("..")) {
1207                    File f = new File(decodedPath);
1208                    String canonicalPath = f.getCanonicalPath();
1209                    String absolutePath = f.getAbsolutePath();
1210                    isSafe = canonicalPath.equals(absolutePath);
1211                }
1212            }
1213        } catch (Exception e) {
1214            isSafe = false;
1215        }
1216        return isSafe;
1217    }
1218
1219    /**
1220     * Identify if an XML contains any XML comments or have any XSL processing instructions.<br>
1221     * Stream reader based parsing is used to support large XML tree.
1222     *
1223     * @param xmlFilePath Filename of the XML file to check.
1224     * @return True only if XML comments or XSL processing instructions are identified.
1225     * @see "https://www.tutorialspoint.com/xml/xml_processing.htm"
1226     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/21/docs/api/java.xml/javax/xml/stream/XMLInputFactory.html"
1227     * @see "https://portswigger.net/kb/issues/00400700_xml-entity-expansion"
1228     * @see "https://www.w3.org/Style/styling-XML.en.html"
1229     */
1230    public static boolean isXMLHaveCommentsOrXSLProcessingInstructions(String xmlFilePath) {
1231        boolean itemsDetected = false;
1232        try {
1233            //Ensure that the parser will not be prone XML external entity (XXE) injection or XML entity expansion (XEE) attacks
1234            XMLInputFactory xmlInputFactory = XMLInputFactory.newFactory();
1235            xmlInputFactory.setProperty(XMLInputFactory.SUPPORT_DTD, false);
1236            xmlInputFactory.setProperty(XMLConstants.ACCESS_EXTERNAL_DTD, "");
1237            xmlInputFactory.setProperty(XMLInputFactory.IS_REPLACING_ENTITY_REFERENCES, false);
1238            xmlInputFactory.setProperty(XMLInputFactory.IS_SUPPORTING_EXTERNAL_ENTITIES, false);
1239
1240            //Parse file
1241            try (FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(xmlFilePath)) {
1242                XMLStreamReader reader = xmlInputFactory.createXMLStreamReader(fis);
1243                int eventType;
1244                while (reader.hasNext() && !itemsDetected) {
1245                    eventType = reader.next();
1246                    if (eventType == XMLEvent.COMMENT) {
1247                        itemsDetected = true;
1248                    } else if (eventType == XMLEvent.PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION && "xml-stylesheet".equalsIgnoreCase(reader.getPITarget())) {
1249                        itemsDetected = true;
1250                    }
1251                }
1252            }
1253        } catch (Exception e) {
1254            //In case of error then assume that the check failed
1255            itemsDetected = true;
1256        }
1257        return itemsDetected;
1258    }
1259
1260
1261    /**
1262     * Perform a set of additional validations against a JWT token:
1263     * <ul>
1264     *     <li>Do not use the <b>NONE</b> signature algorithm.</li>
1265     *     <li>Have a <a href="https://www.iana.org/assignments/jwt/jwt.xhtml">EXP claim</a> defined.</li>
1266     *     <li>The token identifier (<a href="https://www.iana.org/assignments/jwt/jwt.xhtml">JTI claim</a>) is NOT part of the list of revoked token.</li>
1267     *     <li>Match the expected type of token: ACCESS or ID or REFRESH.</li>
1268     * </ul>
1269     *
1270     * @param token               JWT token for which <b>signature was already validated</b> and on which a set of additional validations will be applied.
1271     * @param expectedTokenType   The type of expected token using the enumeration provided.
1272     * @param revokedTokenJTIList A list of token identifier (<b>JTI</b> claim) referring to tokens that were revoked and to which the JTI claim of the token will be compared to.
1273     * @return True only the token pass all the validations.
1274     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/jwt/jwt.xhtml"
1275     * @see "https://auth0.com/docs/secure/tokens/access-tokens"
1276     * @see "https://auth0.com/docs/secure/tokens/id-tokens"
1277     * @see "https://auth0.com/docs/secure/tokens/refresh-tokens"
1278     * @see "https://auth0.com/blog/id-token-access-token-what-is-the-difference/"
1279     * @see "https://jwt.io/libraries?language=Java"
1280     * @see "https://pentesterlab.com/blog/secure-jwt-library-design"
1281     * @see "https://github.com/auth0/java-jwt"
1282     */
1283    public static boolean applyJWTExtraValidation(DecodedJWT token, TokenType expectedTokenType, List<String> revokedTokenJTIList) {
1284        boolean isValid = false;
1285        TokenType tokenType;
1286        try {
1287            if (!"none".equalsIgnoreCase(token.getAlgorithm().trim())) {
1288                if (!token.getClaim("exp").isMissing() && token.getExpiresAt() != null) {
1289                    String jti = token.getId();
1290                    if (jti != null && !jti.trim().isEmpty()) {
1291                        boolean jtiIsRevoked = revokedTokenJTIList.stream().anyMatch(jti::equalsIgnoreCase);
1292                        if (!jtiIsRevoked) {
1293                            //Determine the token type based on the presence of specifics claims
1294                            if (!token.getClaim("scope").isMissing()) {
1295                                tokenType = TokenType.ACCESS;
1296                            } else if (!token.getClaim("name").isMissing() || !token.getClaim("email").isMissing()) {
1297                                tokenType = TokenType.ID;
1298                            } else {
1299                                tokenType = TokenType.REFRESH;
1300                            }
1301                            isValid = (tokenType.equals(expectedTokenType));
1302                        }
1303                    }
1304                }
1305            }
1306
1307        } catch (Exception e) {
1308            //In case of error then assume that the check failed
1309            isValid = false;
1310        }
1311        return isValid;
1312    }
1313
1314    /**
1315     * Apply a validations on a regular expression to ensure that is not prone to the ReDOS attack.
1316     * <br>If your technology is supported by <a href="https://github.com/doyensec/regexploit">regexploit</a> then <b>use it instead of this method!</b>
1317     * <br>Indeed, the <a href="https://www.doyensec.com/">Doyensec</a> team has made an intensive and amazing work on this topic and created this effective tool.
1318     *
1319     * @param regex                       String expected to be a valid regular expression (regex).
1320     * @param data                        Test data on which the regular expression is executed for the test.
1321     * @param maximumRunningTimeInSeconds Optional parameter to specify a number of seconds above which a regex execution time is considered as not safe (default to 4 seconds when not specified).
1322     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
1323     * @see "https://github.blog/security/how-to-fix-a-redos/"
1324     * @see "https://learn.snyk.io/lesson/redos"
1325     * @see "https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/RSPEC-2631/"
1326     * @see "https://github.com/doyensec/regexploit"
1327     * @see "https://wiki.owasp.org/images/2/23/OWASP_IL_2009_ReDoS.pdf"
1328     * @see "https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Regular_expression_Denial_of_Service_-_ReDoS"
1329     */
1330    public static boolean isRegexSafe(String regex, String data, Optional<Integer> maximumRunningTimeInSeconds) {
1331        Objects.requireNonNull(maximumRunningTimeInSeconds, "Use 'Optional.empty()' to leverage the default value.");
1332        Objects.requireNonNull(data, "A sample data is needed to perform the test.");
1333        Objects.requireNonNull(regex, "A regular expression is needed to perform the test.");
1334        boolean isSafe = false;
1335        int executionTimeout = maximumRunningTimeInSeconds.orElse(4);
1336        ExecutorService executor = Executors.newSingleThreadExecutor();
1337        try {
1338            Callable<Boolean> task = () -> {
1339                Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile(regex);
1340                return pattern.matcher(data).matches();
1341            };
1342            List<Future<Boolean>> tasks = executor.invokeAll(List.of(task), executionTimeout, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
1343            if (!tasks.getFirst().isCancelled()) {
1344                isSafe = true;
1345            }
1346        } catch (Exception e) {
1347            isSafe = false;
1348        } finally {
1349            executor.shutdownNow();
1350        }
1351        return isSafe;
1352    }
1353
1354    /**
1355     * Compute a UUID version 7 without using any external dependency.<br><br>
1356     * <b>Below are my personal point of view and perhaps I'm totally wrong!</b>
1357     * <br><br>
1358     * Why such method?
1359     * <ul>
1360     * <li>Java inferior or equals to 21 does not supports natively the generation of an UUID version 7.</li>
1361     * <li>Import a library just to generate such value is overkill for me.</li>
1362     * <li>Library that I have found, generating such version of an UUID, are not provided by entities commonly used in the java world, such as the SPRING framework provider.</li>
1363     * </ul>
1364     * <br>
1365     * <b>Full credits for this implementation goes to the authors and contributors of the <a href="https://github.com/nalgeon/uuidv7">UUIDv7</a> project.</b>
1366     * <br><br>
1367     * Below are the java libraries that I have found but, for which, I do not trust enough the provider to use them directly:
1368     * <ul>
1369     *     <li><a href="https://github.com/cowtowncoder/java-uuid-generator">java-uuid-generator</a></li>
1370     *     <li><a href="https://github.com/f4b6a3/uuid-creator">uuid-creator</a></li>
1371     * </ul>
1372     *
1373     * @return A UUID object representing the UUID v7.
1374     * @see "https://uuid7.com/"
1375     * @see "https://antonz.org/uuidv7/"
1376     * @see "https://mccue.dev/pages/3-11-25-life-altering-postgresql-patterns"
1377     * @see "https://www.ietf.org/archive/id/draft-peabody-dispatch-new-uuid-format-04.html#name-uuid-version-7"
1378     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/java-generating-time-based-uuids"
1379     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier"
1380     * @see "https://buildkite.com/resources/blog/goodbye-integers-hello-uuids/"
1381     */
1382    public static UUID computeUUIDv7() {
1383        SecureRandom secureRandom = new SecureRandom();
1384        // Generate truly random bytes
1385        byte[] value = new byte[16];
1386        secureRandom.nextBytes(value);
1387        // Get current timestamp in milliseconds
1388        ByteBuffer timestamp = ByteBuffer.allocate(Long.BYTES);
1389        timestamp.putLong(System.currentTimeMillis());
1390        // Create the TIMESTAMP part of the UUID
1391        System.arraycopy(timestamp.array(), 2, value, 0, 6);
1392        // Create the VERSION and the VARIANT parts of the UUID
1393        value[6] = (byte) ((value[6] & 0x0F) | 0x70);
1394        value[8] = (byte) ((value[8] & 0x3F) | 0x80);
1395        //Create the HIGH and LOW parts of the UUID
1396        ByteBuffer buf = ByteBuffer.wrap(value);
1397        long high = buf.getLong();
1398        long low = buf.getLong();
1399        //Create and return the UUID object
1400        UUID uuidv7 = new UUID(high, low);
1401        return uuidv7;
1402    }
1403
1404    /**
1405     * Ensure that an XSD file does not contain any include/import/redefine instruction (prevent exposure to SSRF).
1406     *
1407     * @param xsdFilePath Filename of the XSD file to check.
1408     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
1409     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/ssrf"
1410     * @see "https://www.w3schools.com/Xml/el_import.asp"
1411     * @see "https://www.w3schools.com/xml/el_include.asp"
1412     * @see "https://www.linkedin.com/posts/righettod_appsec-appsecurity-java-activity-7344048434326188053-6Ru9"
1413     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/21/docs/api/java.xml/javax/xml/validation/SchemaFactory.html#setProperty(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object)"
1414     */
1415    public static boolean isXSDSafe(String xsdFilePath) {
1416        boolean isSafe = false;
1417        try {
1418            File xsdFile = new File(xsdFilePath);
1419            if (xsdFile.exists() && xsdFile.canRead() && xsdFile.isFile()) {
1420                //Parse the XSD file, if an exception occur then it's imply that the XSD specified is not a valid ones
1421                //Create an schema factory throwing Exception if a external schema is specified
1422                SchemaFactory schemaFactory = SchemaFactory.newDefaultInstance();
1423                schemaFactory.setProperty(XMLConstants.ACCESS_EXTERNAL_DTD, "");
1424                schemaFactory.setProperty(XMLConstants.ACCESS_EXTERNAL_SCHEMA, "");
1425                //Parse the schema
1426                Schema schema = schemaFactory.newSchema(xsdFile);
1427                isSafe = (schema != null);
1428            }
1429        } catch (Exception e) {
1430            isSafe = false;
1431        }
1432        return isSafe;
1433    }
1434
1435
1436    /**
1437     * Extract all sensitive information from a string provided.<br>
1438     * This can be used to identify any sensitive information into a <a href="https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/532.html">message expected to be written in a log</a> and then replace every sensitive values by an obfuscated ones.<br><br>
1439     * For the luxembourg national identification number, this method focus on detecting identifiers for a physical entity (people) and not a moral one (company).<br><br>
1440     * I delegated the validation of the IBAN to a dedicated library (<a href="https://github.com/arturmkrtchyan/iban4j">iban4j</a>) to not "reinvent the wheel" and then introduce buggy validation myself. I used <b>iban4j</b> over the <b><a href="https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/IBANValidator.html">IBANValidator</a></b> class from the <a href="https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/"><b>Apache Commons Validator</b></a> library because <b>iban4j</b> perform a full official IBAN specification validation so its reduce risks of false-positives by ensuring that an IBAN detected is a real IBAN.<br><br>
1441     * Same thing and reason regarding the validation of the bank card PAN using the  class <a href="https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/CreditCardValidator.html">CreditCardValidator</a> from the <b>Apache Commons Validator</b> library.
1442     *
1443     * @param content String in which sensitive information must be searched.
1444     * @return A map with the collection of identified sensitive information gathered by sensitive information type. If nothing is found then the map is empty. A type of sensitive information is only present if there is at least one item found. A set is used to not store duplicates occurrence of the same sensitive information.
1445     * @throws Exception If any error occurs during the processing.
1446     * @see "https://guichet.public.lu/en/citoyens/citoyennete/registre-national/identification/demande-numero-rnpp.html"
1447     * @see "https://cnpd.public.lu/fr/decisions-avis/2009/identifiant-unique.html"
1448     * @see "https://cnpd.public.lu/content/dam/cnpd/fr/decisions-avis/2009/identifiant-unique/48_2009.pdf"
1449     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Bank_Account_Number"
1450     * @see "https://www.iban.com/structure"
1451     * @see "https://github.com/arturmkrtchyan/iban4j"
1452     * @see "https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/532.html"
1453     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/logback-mask-sensitive-data"
1454     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Payment_card_number"
1455     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/CreditCardValidator.html"
1456     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/"
1457     */
1458    public static Map<SensitiveInformationType, Set<String>> extractAllSensitiveInformation(String content) throws Exception {
1459        CreditCardValidator creditCardValidator = CreditCardValidator.genericCreditCardValidator();
1460        Pattern nationalIdentifierRegex = Pattern.compile("([0-9]{13})");
1461        Pattern ibanNonHumanFormattedRegex = Pattern.compile("([A-Z]{2}[0-9]{2}[A-Z0-9]{11,30})", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
1462        Pattern ibanHumanFormattedRegex = Pattern.compile("([A-Z]{2}[0-9]{2}(?:\\s[A-Z0-9]{4}){2,7}\\s[A-Z0-9]{1,4})", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
1463        Pattern panRegex = Pattern.compile("((?:\\d[ -]*?){13,19})");
1464        Map<SensitiveInformationType, Set<String>> data = new HashMap<>();
1465        data.put(SensitiveInformationType.LUXEMBOURG_NATIONAL_IDENTIFICATION_NUMBER, new HashSet<>());
1466        data.put(SensitiveInformationType.IBAN, new HashSet<>());
1467        data.put(SensitiveInformationType.BANK_CARD_PAN, new HashSet<>());
1468
1469        if (content != null && !content.isBlank()) {
1470            /* Step 1: Search for LU national identifier */
1471            //A national identifier have the following structure: [BIRTHDATE_YEAR_YYYY][BIRTHDATE_MONTH_MM][BIRTHDATE_DAY_DD][FIVE_INTEGER]
1472            //Define minimal and maximal birth year base on current year
1473            //Assume people live less than 120 years
1474            int maxBirthYear = LocalDate.now(ZoneId.of("Europe/Luxembourg")).getYear();
1475            int minBirthYear = maxBirthYear - 120;
1476            Matcher matcher = nationalIdentifierRegex.matcher(content);
1477            String nationalIdentierFull;
1478            int nationalIdentierYear, nationalIdentierMonth, nationalIdentierDay;
1479            while (matcher.find()) {
1480                nationalIdentierFull = matcher.group(1);
1481                //Check that the string is a valid national identifier and if yes then add it
1482                nationalIdentierYear = Integer.parseInt(nationalIdentierFull.substring(0, 4));
1483                nationalIdentierMonth = Integer.parseInt(nationalIdentierFull.substring(4, 6));
1484                nationalIdentierDay = Integer.parseInt(nationalIdentierFull.substring(6, 8));
1485                if (nationalIdentierYear >= minBirthYear && nationalIdentierYear <= maxBirthYear) {
1486                    if (nationalIdentierMonth >= 1 && nationalIdentierMonth <= 12) {
1487                        if (YearMonth.of(nationalIdentierYear, nationalIdentierMonth).isValidDay(nationalIdentierDay)) {
1488                            data.get(SensitiveInformationType.LUXEMBOURG_NATIONAL_IDENTIFICATION_NUMBER).add(nationalIdentierFull);
1489                        }
1490                    }
1491                }
1492            }
1493
1494            /* Step 2a: Search for IBAN that are non human formatted */
1495            matcher = ibanNonHumanFormattedRegex.matcher(content);
1496            String iban, ibanUpperCased;
1497            while (matcher.find()) {
1498                iban = matcher.group(1);
1499                ibanUpperCased = iban.toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT);
1500                //Check that the string is a valid IBAN and if yes then add it
1501                if (IbanUtil.isValid(ibanUpperCased)) {
1502                    data.get(SensitiveInformationType.IBAN).add(iban);
1503                }
1504            }
1505
1506            /* Step 2b: Search for IBAN that are human formatted */
1507            matcher = ibanHumanFormattedRegex.matcher(content);
1508            String ibanUpperCasedNoSpace;
1509            while (matcher.find()) {
1510                iban = matcher.group(1);
1511                ibanUpperCasedNoSpace = iban.toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT).replace(" ", "");
1512                //Check that the string is a valid IBAN and if yes then add it
1513                if (IbanUtil.isValid(ibanUpperCasedNoSpace)) {
1514                    data.get(SensitiveInformationType.IBAN).add(iban);
1515                }
1516            }
1517
1518            /* Step 3: Search for bank card PAN */
1519            matcher = panRegex.matcher(content);
1520            String pan, panNoSeparator;
1521            while (matcher.find()) {
1522                pan = matcher.group(1);
1523                panNoSeparator = pan.toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT).replace(" ", "").replace("-", "");
1524                //Check that the string is a valid PAN and if yes then add it
1525                if (creditCardValidator.isValid(panNoSeparator)) {
1526                    data.get(SensitiveInformationType.BANK_CARD_PAN).add(pan);
1527                }
1528            }
1529
1530        }
1531
1532        //Cleanup if a set is empty
1533        if (data.get(SensitiveInformationType.LUXEMBOURG_NATIONAL_IDENTIFICATION_NUMBER).isEmpty()) {
1534            data.remove(SensitiveInformationType.LUXEMBOURG_NATIONAL_IDENTIFICATION_NUMBER);
1535        }
1536        if (data.get(SensitiveInformationType.IBAN).isEmpty()) {
1537            data.remove(SensitiveInformationType.IBAN);
1538        }
1539        if (data.get(SensitiveInformationType.BANK_CARD_PAN).isEmpty()) {
1540            data.remove(SensitiveInformationType.BANK_CARD_PAN);
1541        }
1542
1543        return data;
1544    }
1545}
